scope.narrative: Data published on IATI will be staged and eventually aim to cover 100% of the funds received by the organisation. Some information might be excluded following the finalisation of the disclosure policy; however, this is expected to be minimal.

publication-timetable.narrative: Data will be published from May 2012 and initially include the organisation data file and a limited number of activities. New activity data files will be added as soon as an automated system for the generation of the data files is implemented, or a public Excel/web entry platform is available. Full IATI implementation is envisaged from January 2014

publication-frequency.narrative: Data authorised for release will be published quarterly, and include new entries and updates of previous information.

publication-lifecycle.narrative: Data will be published once contracts have been signed and data has been authorised for release.

data-quality.narrative: Data authorised for release will be verified and quality checked on a sample basis before first publication. As part of the regular quarterly updates, all published data will also be verified and quality checked, and amended if deemed necessary.

approach.narrative: Responsibility for IATI implementation rests with the IATI Implementation Team at TI-S, made up of 5 staff members, including representatives from resource development, policy and research, governance, communications and finance. The team reports regularly to the Management Group.

notes.narrative: TI-S has recently implemented a new financial and accounting system, and is still working towards its full operation –a key priority for the organisation. Hence, IATI data published in the foreseeable future (i.e. up to December 2013) is unlikely to be automated, and will therefore require significant staff resources, particularly from the finance team. In the medium term, it is envisaged that the new system will make possible the automatic processing and uploading of the data in compliance with the IATI standard.

thresholds.narrative: No thresholds will be established on the financial value of activity related data being published.

exclusions.narrative:
No exclusion of data is envisaged. However, where there is reason to believe that publication would present a credible risk to organisations or individuals involved, or the organisation is required by local regulations (e.g. Data Protection) not to publish information, TI-S will manually exclude the data.
Additionally, TI-S may exclude historical data, that is, any information related to activities (programmes/projects) that have been closed on or before 1 April 2012.

license.narrative: TI-S data will be published under the Open Data Commons - Attribution License (ODC-BY).

activity-multilevel.narrative: TI-S operates under the following structures: Programmes (a comprehensive set of integrated initiatives (projects, networks and stand-alone activities), projects (a temporary endeavour with a defined beginning and end, undertaken to meet unique goals and objectives, typically to bring about beneficial change or added value.), sub-projects (a project, or a part thereof, delivered by a partner organisation) and activities (a task, or set of tasks, that occurs over time, has recognizable results and is managed). In the context of IATI, TI-S’ programmes/projects/subprojects will be mapped to the definition of Activity within the Standard.

segmentation.narrative: A number of TI-S programmes/projects are multi-country, either global or regional. Hence, activity data will be published as a single file, encoded as per the IATI data specification, for eachactivity (i.e. unit of aid) .

user-interface.narrative: TI-S will publish raw data and no user interface is planned for the foreseeable future.

total-budget.notes: Current year budget (at an aggregate level) to be published following Board approval.

document-link.notes: Public documents related to TI-S as an organisation are available at: http://www.transparency.org/p ublications/publications

transaction.provider-definition: “Disbursements” refer to payments made to partner organisations, particularly TI National Chapters; while “expenditure” refers to the expenses directly incurred by TI-S.
